trial_identification.scientifictitle: Randomised Controlled Trial of a Shared Care Model of Care for patients receiving chemotherapy in a tertiary setting and their General Practitioners, to ascertain benefits to the patient's wellbeing, GP confidence and cost benefit to the tertiary health provider

conditions.healthcondition: Patients receiving chemotherapy for B cell lymphoma or early breast cancer

interventions.interventions: Shared Care model - comprised of 1. Patient Held Record 2. GP education 3. Increased GP involvement 4. Shared Care coordinator The duration of the intervention/control will be for the length of time that the patient is receiving chemotherapy. patients.
interventions.comparator: This is 6 months for the breast cancer patients and 3 months for the Lymphoma

primaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured at commencement of the study, half way through the study (ie 6 weeks for lymphoma patients, 3 months for Breast Cancer patients and at the end of the study ie cessation of chemotherapy)

secondaryOutcome.outcome: 1. Number of non treatment visits to tertiary setting.
2. Cost benefit to the tertiary setting

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Newly diagnosed B cell lymphoma or early breast cancer patients receiving adjuvant chemotherapy.- Patient consent-GP consent.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Inability to understand or complete trial documentation-Patient's GP is already participating in the trial.

trial_design.concealment: Envelopes containing randomisation are generated externally, then opened in front of patient by study coordinator after baseline surveys
trial_design.sequence: Sequence generation was done separately within each of the 4 main stata which are rural/metro and lymphoma/breast cancer. Permuted block randomisation used.

secondarysponsor.sponsorname: Principal Investigators: Assoc Prof Alison Ward

ethicsAndSummary.summary: A trial to determine the efficacy of a shared care model of care for patients receiving chemotherapy for lymphoma or breast cancer at Sir Charles Gairdner Hospital, WA.
